isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - ASSEMBLE - STANDARD SHIFTER HOUSING (1X707 MODELS)

svcproc.title: STANDARD SHIFTER HOUSING (1X707 MODELS)
svcproc.para: Inspect the shift blocks and shift yokes for wear.

Apply Eaton sealant #71208 or Loctite 242 to the shifter housing plugs which are used to plug the oil cooler provision holes. The sealant should be applied so that at least 5 complete threads are covered.

Apply Eaton lockwire #1819 or equivalent to all shifter housing assembly set screws in both blocks and yokes. The wire should anchor the setscrew at least 2 complete 360° turns. The lockwire ends should be trimmed and bent out of the way of any part interference.
Keep yoke bars in neutral while assembling.

step1.para: Assemble the 1st & reverse shift yoke assembly ( Figure 126):

step2.para: Install the plunger in the 1st & reverse shift yoke bore, plunger shank to the outside.
Install the spring into the bore over the plunger shank.
Install the plug and tighten to compress the spring.
After the plug bottoms out, back the plug out 1 to 1-1/2 turns.
Complete the block assembly process by staking the plug through the small hole in block.

step1.para: With the housing rear to the right, lay the assembly on a flat surface ( Figure 127).
Start installation of the bottom shift bar. As the bar passes the bosses, install the bottom shift yoke assembly ( Figure 127). Finish installation.
Install the shift yoke lockscrew. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely.
Place the actuating plunger in the top center bore ( Figure 128).
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the bottom bar ( Figure 128).
Holding the middle bar notched end, start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 129).
As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing front ( Figure 129).
Just prior to inserting the notched end of the bar in the rear boss, install the small interlock pin vertically in the neutral notch bore ( Figure 129).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely.
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the middle bar ( Figure 130).
Holding the top bar notched end, start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 131).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Position Shift Yoke On Bar

step1.para: As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing rear ( Figure 131).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely.
If equipped, install the oil trough. Tighten the retaining bolts to 8 to 12 ft-lbs. (11 to 16 N•m).
Install the three (3) tension balls, one in each housing top bore. Install the three (3) detent springs, one over each tension ball.

svcproc.para: Make sure interlock system is working- can't shift into 2 gears at the same time.
Make sure all lockscrews are lockwired.
